MICHIGAN STATE UNIVERSITY
OF AGRICULTURE AND APPLIED SCIENCE . EAST LANSING
TELEVISION STATION • WKAR-TV
January 9, 19^6
Dr. Harry J. Skornia
National Association of Educational Broadcasters
1U Gregory Hall
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Harry:
I have before me from the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation,
the first and second CBC Halifax-Dartmouth studies which are
4- titled "Radio Listening Patterns in a Canadian Communication . . .
"before" Television."
May I suggest you write to B. K. 3yram, Supervisor of
Analysis and Reports, Audience Research Division, CBC, P. 0*
Box 806, Ottawa, Ontario, Canada for a copy for the NAEB head¬
quarters library.
I notice the Audience Studies Section of the Fact Sheet
Service is mighty thin and it is my opinion that some kind of
report on these two important studies should be made. I will
be glad to attempt a summary if you want me to.
Incidentally, when you write Byram, inquire about the confi¬
dential classification which appears on Part I of the study only.
This might affect what could be reported. My guess is that
several non-CBC stations were mentioned by name. Naturally our
report would not need to identify particular stations in this
manner.
My audience study of Lansing has been completed and is
now awaiting duplication for distribution. I have the head¬
quarters included in the folder of requests for copies of same.
Sincerely,
Irving R. Merrill
Director of Television Research,WKAR
